components.description: A man wearing a turban; a form of customary headwear worn by Sikhs or Muslims.
components.title: Man with Turban

description: A man wearing a turban; a form of customary headwear worn by Sikhs or Muslims.
title: Man with Turban

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Portrait and role symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A man wearing a turban; a form of customary headwearÂ worn by Sikhs or Muslims. Person Wearing Turban was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in  http://emojipedia.org/man-with-turban/
emoji_net_data.name: person wearing turban

bn:00106354a: Of, relating to, or denoting a member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
Being the sex (of plant or animal) that produces gametes (spermatozoa) that perform the fertilizing function in generation

bn:00104941a: Of or relating to or characteristic of India or the East Indies or their peoples or languages or cultures
Of or relating to India or its people; or (formerly) of the East Indies.

bn:00089233v: Put on or wear a hat

bn:00001533n: Sexual maturity is the age or stage when an organism can reproduce.
The age or stage when an organism can reproduce
A man is a male human.
An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A human member of the masculine sex or gender.
An adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)

bn:00015784n: A head is the cephalic part of an organism, which usually comprises the eyes, ears, nose and mouth, each of which aid in various sensory functions, such as sight, hearing, smell, and taste.
A Head is the cephalic part of an animal, which usually comprises the eyes, ears, nose and mouth, each of which aid in various sensory functions, such as sight, hearing, smell, and taste.
The upper part of the human body or the front part of the body in animals; contains the face and brains
The part of the body of an animal or human which contains the brain, mouth and main sense organs.

bn:00055975n: A Muslim or Moslem is an adherent of the religion of Islam.
A believer in or follower of Islam
A person who is a follower and believer of Islam.
A Muslim, sometimes spelled Moslem, is a follower of the religion of Islam, a monotheistic Abrahamic religion based on the Quran.
An adherent of the religion of Islam.

bn:00052968n: Determined sex of an animal. Use Q6581097 for a male human
A member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A person who belongs to the sex that cannot have babies
A male organism is the physiological sex which produces sperm.
An animal of the sex that has testes.

bn:00046516n: A person, especially as one among many.
An individual is a person or a specific object.
A single physical human being as a legal subject, as opposed to a legal person such as a corporation.
A human; someone susceptible to death.

A person is a being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood, which in turn is defined differently by different authors in different disciplines, and by different cultures in different times and places.
A person that will die eventually.
A being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood
Abstract term defining a being, e.g. a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood (not for use with "instance of" [P31], instead use "human" [Q5])
An individual; usually a human being.

bn:00072381n: The practice of hypnotising a snake by playing an instrument, the performance of which may also include handling the snakes or performing other seemingly dangerous acts.
A performer who entertains crowds by performing tricks with dangerous snakes.
A performer who uses movements and music to control snakes
Snake charming is the practice of pretending to hypnotise a snake by playing an instrument called pungi.
A performer who uses movements and music to control snakes.

bn:00071567n: Sikhism is a monotheistic religion founded during the 15th century in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent by Guru Nanak and developed through the teachings of ten successive Sikh Gurus.

Sikhism is a monotheistic religion founded during the 15th century in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent, by Guru Nanak, which continued to develop through the ten successive Sikh gurus, the eleventh and last guru being the holy scripture Guru Granth Sahib, a collection of the Sikh Gurus' writings.
The doctrines of a monotheistic religion founded in northern India in the 16th century by Guru Nanak and combining elements of Hinduism and Islam
A revealed, monotheistic religion originating in northern India, in the 16th century, through Guru Nanak and his successors.

bn:00078617n: A traditional Muslim headdress consisting of a long scarf wrapped around the head
Man's headdress made by winding a length of cloth round the head.
Manâ€™s headdress made by winding a length of cloth round the head.
For the millinery fashion, see Draped turban A turban is a kind of headwear based on cloth winding.

bn:00060406n: An Indic language spoken mainly in the Punjab regions of India and Pakistan.
The main language spoken in the Punjab region, in Northern India and Eastern Pakistan.
Punjabi is an Indo-Aryan language spoken by 102 million native speakers worldwide, making it the 10th most widely spoken language in the world.
A language spoken by inhabitants of the Punjab region
The Indic language spoken by most people in Punjab in northwestern India
Language spoken in the Punjab region, in Northern India and Eastern Pakistan.

bn:00010203n: India, officially the Republic of India, is a country in South Asia.
Country in Southern Asia (Bharat). Official name: Republic of India.
A republic in the Asian subcontinent in southern Asia; second most populous country in the world; achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1947
A country in South Asia, with the capital New Delhi.

Nelumbo nucifera. It is one of the names of the mythological character Krishna. Aravind?ksha, "lotus-eyed", appears as the 347th name of the Vishnu sahasranama. The variant spelling Aravind is more popular in North India. Aravindha is an uncommon variant and Arvindh is very rare.
India is a country on the Asian continent.

bn:00001816n: The second largest of the continents, on the Mediterranean in the north, the Atlantic in the west, and the Red Sea, Gulf of Aden, and Indian Ocean in the east.
The continent that is south of Europe, east of the Atlantic Ocean, west of the Indian Ocean and north of Antarctica. It holds the following countries:
The second largest continent; located to the south of Europe and bordered to the west by the South Atlantic and to the east by the Indian Ocean
From a Eurocentric point of view.
Africa is the world's second-largest and second-most-populous continent.

bn:00044181n: Hinduism is a religious tradition that originated in the Indian subcontinent in ancient times, referred as San?tana Dharma by its practitioners, a Sanskrit phrase meaning "the eternal principle."
A religion, philosophy and culture native to India, characterized by the belief in reincarnation and a supreme oneness personified in many forms and natures.
Hinduism is the dominant religion, or way of life, of the Indian subcontinent, and consists of many diverse traditions.

Kamla is another name of Lakshmi, consort of Vishnu. The name is derived from word Kamal, another name of Vishnu, and a lso meaning lotus in Sanskrit. Kamla is a common feminine given name, just as Padma, Kumud and Kumudini, all synonyms for Lotus. Kamla also gives rise another common masculine given name, Kamla Kant another name of Vishnu. Also written as Kamala

A body of religious and philosophical beliefs and cultural practices native to India and based on a caste system; it is characterized by a belief in reincarnation, by a belief in a supreme being of many forms and natures, by the view that opposing theories are aspects of one eternal truth, and by a desire for liberation from earthly evils
A religion originating from India including the belief in reincarnation.

bn:00012569n: A boy is a young male human, usually child or adolescent.
A young male person, usually a child or teenager.
A young male human; a male child or young adult.

bn:00005248n: A Semitic person, whose antecedents were from Arabia
Arabs are a major panethnic group.
A member of a Semitic people originally from the Arabian peninsula and surrounding territories who speaks Arabic and who inhabits much of the Middle East and northern Africa

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the person wearing a turban emoji showcases a rich cultural representation with Appleâ€™s hallmark attention to detail and soft, rounded forms. The turban itself is depicted with flowing fabric textures and subtle shading, indicating a sense of elegance and tradition, while the visible face is rendered with a neutral, approachable expression. This emoji, a beautiful addition to the Apple emoji set, signifies respect for diverse cultures, religious identity, or simply represents an individual with a distinct style, fostering understanding and inclusivity in digital conversations.
